text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I want
to show you what I like to call my chai
tea latte banana muffins now if you've
been a watcher of Lory the kitchen for
years you know I have a wild obsession
with banana bread or anything banana
flavored I've made so many different
kinds of banana bread throughout the
years even banana muffins but these are
so fantastic they don't have that much
sugar in them they have really a little
bit of fat you know and they're just you
know I don't care about that kind of
thing but when they're this good they
need to be shared and they need to be in
your recipe repertoire because they are
absolutely fantastic and I cannot wait
to show you how easy they are to make
let me show you the ingredients you'll
need all-purpose flour
I also have a little bit of salt and
baking powder along with some cinnamon
what I have here is some unsweetened
vanilla almond milk I also have some
granulated sugar some eggs just a little
bit of vegetable oil you need a chai tea
tea bag and then you're gonna need some
vanilla extract and some bananas you can
see my bananas are not the prettiest
thing in the world but the key to making
anything really yummy with bananas is to
let them get really ripe to the point
where it might not cause them too ugly
to eat raw but they are amazing for
baking because they really intensify
their sweetness and become really lovely
and soft so that they incorporate
throughout your batters really really
easily and I'm telling you when you eat
them that way in baking you don't need
to add that much sugar because they are
naturally really sweet when you let them
ripen okay the very first thing I do is
work on my chai tea latte portion now
I'm making a full cup here you only
gonna need half of the amount but the
reason why I do that is because well if
you were making a 24 cup 24 muffins you
wouldn't need a whole cup but the reason
why I do I do the whole batch even
though I only need a half a cup is
because otherwise the chai tea bag would
be really really strong the chai tea
flavor would be too strong so what I do
is I just put it in there like that
- a bubble like to a simmer around the
edges and then all I do is with it steep
for about 10 minutes and now I'll use
half of it in this recipe now and the
other half I think store it in the
fridge and I could use it another time
or I can use it and dilute it with some
more almond milk and there I have what I
like to call a guilt-free chai tea latte
with no effort whatsoever so I'm gonna
let that happen
and then we'll proceed my chai tea
mixture has been sitting for 10 minutes
now I am aware that a lot of places in
the world chai just means tea but here
in the US any time you hear the word
chai it usually means it's like a tea
that's spiced with lots of different
aromatics like cloves and send them in
and all those beautiful warm spices so
that's what I mean by that now what I
did here online thing is I've taken my
super by Pat bananas and I just peel
them and I mash them with my fork this
is such an easy recipe and one of the
reasons why I love making putting out
anything is that it's just it's
incredibly easy everything can go in One
Bowl you don't have to worry about it
chi lodge and it's perfect every single
time and now to my mashed bananas first
of all you want to make sure your ovens
preheated to 375 and then get a muffin
pan ready with some liners and then
you're ready to go yeah - my mashed
bananas I'm gonna add a little bit of
vegetable oil you could add melted
butter if you want to but a little veg
oil works just as well and then you do
need a couple of eggs and my sugar and
all I'm going to do is mix these
together with my fork you can also use a
whisk if you want to which I'm gonna
switch to a whisk now and just make some
one tall everything is combined and the
eggs are mixed throughout the bananas
well I'm gonna add a splash or a little
bit more splash of vanilla extract and
then along with that I'm going to add
pretty much everything else I'm gonna
add my flour baking powder salt cinnamon
and my incredibly flavorful
almond milk chai mixture and then just
mix everything until combined but don't
over mix otherwise your muffins will
come out tough
and then just using my ice-cream scoop
just divide your batter evenly real
difficult I know
excellent now all I need to do is pop
these into the oven for around 20
minutes or so or until they're fully
cooked through and that's only what it
looks like when they're done my muffins
baked for 20 minutes and I've let them
cool pretty much completely now as they
cooled they do deflate a little bit
don't panic because they're just as
delicious they smell phenomenal I cannot
wait to dig into these and I should
probably warn you that you will want to
grease your muffin liners a little bit
so that the muffin doesn't stick these
suck a little bit because I didn't do
that but that's okay look at those I
love banana flavored anything and when
you get really really good chai tea
makes all the difference in the world
they're so good mildly spiced they're
gonna go great with any coffee team
anything your heart desires so good just
